channel.title: Help with making my server public--Opening port 43594
channel.description:
[b]NOTE: I DID FIND A TUT ON THIS ALTHOUGH I POSTED SEVERAL TIMES NO ONE HELPED, I USUALLY GET LUCK POSTING IN HERE ;D[/b]
This is what i posted , perhaps someone can help?
so far i got into my router , made the no-ip , although my linksys page is different but i found the equivalent of the gaming/ports page . i did this
Ext.Port 43594 ] To [ 43594
Protocol TCP Checked
Protocol UDP Not checked
IP Address (Box is where i enter a number) 192.168.1.[1 ]
Enable Checked
I tried it , got error connecting to server.
Then i went to windows firewall ...
Went to exceptions , then add port
I entered 43594 And i marked TCP
So i have 43594 unblocked by both router and firewall ....
Still error connecting to server....?? :confused: ??
I don't know whats wrong but for anyone that can help heres some , stuff might help
Here's two things that may make a difference when you try to help!!! Thank you!!!
I have Windows Xp
I DO HAVE AVAST ANTI-VIRUS!!! [I'm unsure of if that effects anything]
Well I hope someone can help me with this , just message me or post back , Thank you!!! :D Matanzes

item.description:
@matanzes wrote:

i already did the firewall :([br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 23, 2008, 11:49:36 pm[/size][hr]anyone else have some help?

Read full topic

ok this is wat happened to me (i have linksys too) go to Seceruity on the linksys internet page, and where it says “block anoymonous requests to internet” UNcheck that box, if you need more help or it doesnt work pm me or post here, gl

43594 ] To [ 43594

Checked

Not checked

192.168.1.[1 ]

Checked

43594
